greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the ratio of the length of the boundary of any arbelos to the length of the boundary of its associated parbelos: Pi / (sqrt(2) + log(1 + sqrt(2))).
comment: Same as decimal expansion of Pi/P, where P is the Universal parabolic constant (A103710). - _Jonathan Sondow_, Jan 19 2015
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. Sondow, The parbelos, a parabolic analog of the arbelos, arXiv 2012, Amer. Math. Monthly, 120 (2013), 929-935.
E. Tsukerman, Solution of Sondow's problem: a synthetic proof of the tangency property of the parbelos, arXiv 2012, Amer. Math. Monthly, 121 (2014), 438-443.
program: (PARI) Pi/(sqrt(2) + log(1 + sqrt(2))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 27 2018
(MAGMA) R:= RealField(); Pi(R)/(Sqrt(2) + Log(1 + Sqrt(2))) // _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 27 2018
xref: Reciprocal of A232716. Ratio of areas is A232715.
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Nov 28 2013
